docs.title: DBT Column Lineage
docs.text: Working with large dbt projects, I kept needing to understand column-level data lineage - is this column a simple projection, used in an aggregation, or what's the impact if I change it? So I built this tool to visualize it. Hopefully dbt core will add this feature one day, but until then, here's a simple solution.

docs.title: What is DBT Column Lineage?
docs.text: DBT Column Lineage analyzes your dbt project artifacts (manifest & catalog) and compiled SQL to provide detailed insights into how data flows through your transformations at the column level.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Interactive Explorer

    A local web server with an intuitive UI to explore model and column lineage visually

  • Static Analysis

    Generate DOT files for GraphViz or view lineage directly in the terminal

  • Column-Level Lineage

    Track which source columns contribute to each downstream column

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
# Install
pip install dbt-col-lineage

# Start exploring
dbt-col-lineage --explore

Get Started

docs.title: Why Use Column-Level Lineage?
docs.text:
• Impact Analysis: Understand downstream effects of schema changes
  • Debugging: Trace data issues to their source
  • Documentation: Visualize complex data transformations
  • Data Governance: Track sensitive data through your pipeline

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Python 3.9 or higher
  • A dbt project with compiled artifacts

docs.title: Install from PyPI
docs.text:
The easiest way to install DBT Column Lineage is via pip:

pip install dbt-col-lineage

This will install the latest stable version and all required dependencies.

docs.title: Install from Source
docs.text:
If you want to contribute or use the latest development version:

# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/Fszta/dbt-column-lineage.git
cd dbt-column-lineage

# Install with Poetry
poetry install

# Or with pip
pip install -e .

docs.title: Verify Installation
docs.text:
Check that the CLI is properly installed:

dbt-col-lineage --help

You should see the help message with all available options.

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
Now that you have DBT Column Lineage installed, let's get started with a quick example:

Quick Start

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text: This guide will help you get started with DBT Column Lineage in just a few minutes.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before using DBT Column Lineage, you need to generate dbt artifacts:

cd your-dbt-project

# Compile your dbt project
dbt compile

# Generate the catalog (required for column information)
dbt docs generate

This creates two files in your target/ directory:

  • manifest.json - Contains model definitions and dependencies
  • catalog.json - Contains column-level metadata

Tip

The catalog file is essential for column-level lineage. Make sure to run dbt docs generate before using this tool.

docs.title: Interactive Explorer (Recommended)
docs.text:
Launch the interactive web interface:

dbt-col-lineage --explore

If your artifacts are in a custom location:

dbt-col-lineage --explore \
    --manifest path/to/manifest.json \
    --catalog path/to/catalog.json \
    --port 8080  # Optional, defaults to 8000

This starts a local web server where you can explore your lineage interactively.

docs.title: Static Analysis
docs.text: For terminal output or documentation, use static analysis:

docs.title: Text Format
docs.text:
# Show all dependencies for a model
dbt-col-lineage --select my_model --format text

# Show downstream dependencies for a specific column
dbt-col-lineage --select stg_orders.order_id+ --format text

# Show upstream dependencies for a column
dbt-col-lineage --select +final_table.revenue --format text

docs.title: DOT Format (GraphViz)
docs.text:
Generate DOT files that can be rendered as images:

dbt-col-lineage --select my_model --format dot --output my_lineage

Then render with GraphViz:

# Install GraphViz (if needed)
# macOS: brew install graphviz
# Ubuntu/Debian: sudo apt-get install graphviz

# Render as PNG
dot -Tpng my_lineage.dot -o my_lineage.png

# Render as SVG
dot -Tsvg my_lineage.dot -o my_lineage.svg

docs.title: Selection Syntax
docs.text:
The selection syntax follows this pattern: [+]model_name[.column_name][+]

Syntax Meaning Example model Both directions stg_orders +model Upstream only +stg_orders model+ Downstream only stg_orders+ model.column Column-level stg_orders.order_id +model.column Upstream column +fct_orders.total_revenue model.column+ Downstream column stg_transactions.amount+

docs.title: Common Use Cases
docs.text:
Trace a column's origins: 

dbt-col-lineage --select +orders.total_amount --format text

Understand impact of changes: 

dbt-col-lineage --select stg_customers.email+ --format text

Generate documentation diagram: 

dbt-col-lineage --select dim_customers --format dot --output customers_lineage
dot -Tsvg customers_lineage.dot -o customers_lineage.svg

Column Names Are Case-Sensitive

Make sure to use the exact column name as it appears in your dbt models.
